sub_topic: Predicting the products of inorganic reactions
message_1: What are the products of the reaction between sodium hydroxide and copper (II) sulfate?
message_2:
The reaction between sodium hydroxide (NaOH) and copper (II) sulfate (CuSO₄) is a double displacement reaction, also known as a metathesis reaction. The products of this reaction are copper (II) hydroxide (Cu(OH)₂) and sodium sulfate (Na₂SO₄). The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

2 NaOH + CuSO₄ → Cu(OH)₂ + Na₂SO₄
